org.jtrim.concurrent

Interface MultiPhaseTask.TerminateListener<ResultType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ResultType - the type of the result of the task this listener receives notification from
    Enclosing class:
    MultiPhaseTask<ResultType>

    public static interface MultiPhaseTask.TerminateListener<ResultType>
    The listener interface which can be notified when a specific MultiPhaseTask terminates.

    Thread safety

    This interface doesn't need to be safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this interface are not required to be synchronization transparent.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onTerminate(ResultType result, java.lang.Throwable exception, boolean canceled)
      Invoked when the associated MultiPhaseTask terminates.

    • Method Detail

      • onTerminate

        void onTerminate(ResultType result,
               java.lang.Throwable exception,
               boolean canceled)
        Invoked when the associated MultiPhaseTask terminates. MultiPhaseTask instances may call this method only once. When this method is called no more tasks scheduled to the MultiPhaseTask allowed to execute (even those scheduled before terminating the task).
        Parameters:
        result - the result of the associated MultiPhaseTask. This argument can be null, if the result of the task is null, or it did not terminate normally (i.e.: has been canceled, caused an exception).
        exception - the exception caused by the associated MultiPhaseTask or null if no such error occurred. Note that usually when this argument is non-null, the result is null but it is not strictly required.
        canceled - true if the associated MultiPhaseTask was canceled, so it could not finish its intended task, false otherwise
